title: Port Elizabeth
summary: Port Elizabeth, officially renamed Gqeberha (Xhosa: [ᶢǃʱɛ̀ɓéːxà]) and colloquially often referred to as PE,[lower-alpha 1]  is a major seaport city and the most populous city in the Eastern Cape province of South Africa. It is the seat of the Nelson Mandela Bay Metropolitan Municipality, South Africa's second-largest metropolitan district by area size.[5] It is the sixth-most-populous city in South Africa[6][7][8] and is the cultural, economic and financial centre of the Eastern Cape.[5][9][10]
